Control.ttp: This page is for maintaining information related to 'System Settings'.
Click to display online help related to this page.
Click to save the contents of this page to the PAC.
Click to refresh the contents of this page with the current values obtained from the PAC.
Click to reset the contents of this page to what it was following the last save.
Click to synchronize the 'Machine Date Time' on the PAC with the 'Internet Time Server' right now.
Provides the choices for Internet Time Server.

Control.lbl: Automatically adjust clock for Daylight Saving Time
Control.ttp: When checkmarked, the clock on the PAC will automatically be adjusted for 'Daylight Saving Time'.

Control.lbl: Sync with an Internet Time Server (Reboot Required)
Control.ttp: When checkmarked, the date and time on the PAC is synchronized with the date and time obtained from the selected 'Internet Time Server'. (A reboot is initially required once enabled)
When checkmarked, the date and time on the PAC is synchronized with the date and time obtained from this computer.
The unique name of the machine the PAC is running on.
The description of the machine the PAC is running on. It does not need to be unique.
The current date and time on the PAC.
The current time zone on the PAC.
The amount of time to wait until the next synchronization between the internet time server and the PAC.

Messages.Message: The System Settings cannot be saved since the specified Machine Name: '{0}' already exists on this network.
'Machine Name' must be at least 4 characters in length.
'Machine Name' must begin with a character and end with either a character or a number.
Are you sure you want to Reboot the PAC?
'Internet Time Server' must be at least 4 characters in length.
'Refresh Interval' must be at least 5 minutes and no more than 2 weeks.
To effectively initiate the changes made to the current System Settings, it is recommended that you reboot the PAC...
